title: Preference Formation Theory and Experimental Learning: Understanding Choices in Science and Daily Life

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational scientific reasoning skills and understanding of data collection
context.additional_context: Establishment of a real-time data collection and analysis environment using digital devices, emphasizing project-based collaborative learning

learning_goals: Learners can compare and explain three theories describing the preference formation process: innate formation, experiential discovery, and reference point influence
Learners can quantitatively analyze how their preferences change based on repeated experiences and information exposure through experimental design
Learners can propose and evaluate rational decision-making models based on project-specific data on scientific and social phenomena
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
